newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: MUSIC says lawsuit will not hurt income.
newsitem.headline: MUSIC says lawsuit will not hurt income.

text.p: MUSIC Semiconductors Corp said on Tuesday a lawsuit filed by minority shareholders of its subsidiary, ProTelCon Inc, against the two companies will not hurt MUSIC's financial condition.
ProTelCon minority shareholders have filed a civil action with the Superior Court of New Jersey to restrain ProTelCon from turning over to MUSIC assets including patent rights over TeleCommander.
TeleCommander is a television accessory designed and developed by ProTelCon.
MUSIC said it was to receive the TeleCommander patent because ProTelCon had not repaid loans amounting to $1.3 million.

"(The) management ... is of the opinion that liability or loss, if any, arising therefrom will not have a material effect on MUSIC's consolidated financial condition or results of operations," corporate counsel Jimmy Soo said in a letter to the Philippine Stock Exchange.
Soo said the TeleCommander patent will remain under the control of MUSIC directly, if transferred, or indirectly through ProTelCon, of which it is the majority shareholder, if not transferred.
MUSIC manufactures and distributes computer network systems.
MUSIC's shares were unchanged by late session on Tuesday at 15 pesos.
